title: What thing only exists in your country? - Quora

response.answer_text: And a bit across the border with Belgium and Germany. Hollandse Nieuwe. herring netted in late spring with just the right amount of fat. After these fish are hauled in they are immediately cut to remove the entrails but the pancreas is left in place. Then the fish are put in brine. frozen to minus 18ºC to kill a special herring worm and brought to land. The pancreatic juices start their proteinolytic activity on the herring meat. This proteinolytic activity stops by it self in the briny environment. To consume the herring it is also cut at the back, the vertebral column is removed and The scales are removed and the raw fish is ready to be eaten, raw. Delicious. The technic to remove the entrails immediately on the ship was developed in the fourteenth century by Willem Beukelsz. from Biervliet a small village in Zeeland, a province in the south west of the Netherlands. I prefer it to the Icelandic specialty Hákarl, fermented shark (six months in sand) with the smell (according to a dear friend from Iceland of a man’s bathroom not cleaned in those six months) I had the guts to taste it and swallow it. After swallowing, one needs a swig of brennivin, or whisky. But that only exist in Iceland

INDIA - BHARAT While India is a country synonymous with diversity, with distinguishing features of all form and place, this is something I am sure very few Indians are aware of………that we actually have a MUSEUM FOR TOILETS. And yes, the only country to have one on earth. SULABH INTERNATIONAL MUSEUM OF TOILETS, New Delhi  Given open defecation is a real problem here, knowing such a museum exists exclusively in India was a refreshing fact to know.  Time magazine has even declared it “The weirdest museum in the world”,ranking in the top 10 “anything but mundane” museums of the world. It was established in 1992 by Dr. Bindeshwar Pathak, recipient of national and international awards including the Stockholm water price in 2009. His objective in establishing this museum was to highlight the need to address the problems of the sanitation sector in the country, considering the efforts made in various parts of the world in this field since the third millennium BC.   The museum, established in 1992 has exhibits from 50 countries arranged sequentially in three sections of "Ancient, Medieval and Modern", according to the period of the sanitation artifacts collected from 3000 BC till the end of the 20th century. Some items on display Privies, chamber potsVictorian toilet seats, toilet furniture, bidetA reproduction of the supposed toilet of King Louis XIV which is reported to have been used by the king to defecate while holding courtToilet pots made of gold and silver used by the Roman emperorsSewerage system during Harappan civilizationHistorical information from the Lothal archeological site on the development of toilets during the Indus valley civilization.

I come from India , and we Indian allow a lady of Catholic origin to step aside for a Sikh to be sworn in as Prime Minister by a Muslim President to govern a nation of over 80 percent Hindus. And below points mentioned are the ones which happens only in India . 1.When we greet one another, we fold our hands in namaste because we believe that God resides in the heart of every human being.  2 . We Indians irrespective of caste and religion celebrate different festivals with a unity coz we don't belive anyone is above or below us . A Hindu family will send sweets on Diwali to a Muslim family and a Muslim family sends biriyani to a Hindu family during Ramzan .  3.Holi is a most entertaining festival of India. It is also known as festival of colors as we play with colors at this festival. It is a festival celebrated with lots of joy by Indians . Coldplay has already showedoff in their song “"hymn for the weekend “  4.Mumbai local trains : These trains are the lifeline of the city .This local rail network is the busiest commuter train system in the world with 7.5 million people using the trains to commute .  4. Muslims offering prayer in temple and a Hindu guy stopping other guys to cross over the people who are standing in there namaz India is known for it's vivid cluture . And we Indians are the best example for unity in diversity
Tire centres are only found in Canada. In the USA they are called tire centers. In the UK they are called tyre centres. I wish I could include poutine, but now I’ve seen it outside Canada. Ugh.

A Shaheed Minar built in memory of the mother language martyrs.  A national monument in Dhaka, Bangladesh, established to commemorate the martyrs of the Bengali Language Movement demonstrations of 1952. On February 21, 1952, students from Dhaka University and Dhaka Medical College and several political activists were killed when the Pakistani police force opened fire on Bengali protesters who were demanding official status for their native tongue, Bengali. On 17 November 1999, UNESCO announced 21 February as the International Mother Language Day to promote awareness of linguistic and cultural diversity and multilingualism. The day has been observed worldwide annually since 2000.
